Package BrickDestroy.Gameplay_Model.Brick

Class Brick

java.lang.Object
BrickDestroy.Gameplay_Model.Brick.Brick
Direct Known Subclasses:
CementBrick, ClayBrick, SteelBrick
public abstract class Brick extends Object
A Brick represent a brick that can be broken by the ball in the game.

  • Constructor Details

    • Brick

      public Brick(javafx.geometry.Point2D pos, javafx.geometry.Dimension2D size, javafx.scene.paint.Color border, javafx.scene.paint.Color inner, int hitPoints)
      Initialises the brick with the intended position, size, color and the amount of hitpoints.
      Parameters:
      pos - the position of the brick on the pane
      size - the size of the brick on the pane
      border - the color for the border of the brick
      inner - the color for the brick
      hitPoints - the hitpoints for the brick

    • initialiseBrick

      protected void initialiseBrick(javafx.scene.paint.Color inner, javafx.scene.paint.Color border)
      Initialises the brick with the intended border color and color of the brick.
      Parameters:
      inner - color of the brick
      border - color of the border of the brick

    • collidedWithBall

      public int collidedWithBall(javafx.geometry.Point2D point, int dir)
      Invoked when collision between ball and the brick is detected.
      Parameters:
      point - the point where the ball and brick collided
      dir - the part of the brick where it collided (up, down, left or right)
      Returns:
      score worth of the brick (as indicator of a hit)

    • getCrack

      public Crack getCrack()
      Gets the crack object for the brick.
      Returns:
      crack object for the brick

    • isBroken

      public final boolean isBroken()
      Checks whether brick is broken or not.
      Returns:
      brick is broken or not

    • impact

      protected void impact()
      Stimulate an impact of ball on the brick. Decreases hit points of the brick by 1.

      If hitpoints reaches 0, Brick is broken (destroyed) and the visibility of it's Shape and Crack is set invisible.

    • getBrickFace

      public javafx.scene.shape.Shape getBrickFace()
      Gets the Shape object that represents the brick on the graphics pane.
      Returns:
      the Shape of the object
